intro: Phaca oxyphysa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phaca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. Phaca oxyphysa is often found in maritime environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing dune ecosystems.
